title: The Chocolate River Adventure – Kids find a river made entirely of chocolate.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Forest edge, Character Action: A group of kids, Max, Emma, and Leo, spot something unusual in the distance, Dialogue: 'Is that... a river of chocolate?', Narration: 'It was a day like any other, until they saw something extraordinary.'

output.Setting: A forest edge with thick trees and a glimpse of something brown flowing in the distance.
output.Character Action: Max, Emma, and Leo stand at the forest edge, pointing towards the river.
output.Narration: It was a day like any other, until they saw something extraordinary.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Near the river, Character Action: The kids run towards the river excitedly, Dialogue: 'We have to check this out!', Narration: 'The kids couldn't believe their eyes.'

output.Setting: A clearing near the river, with the chocolate river coming into view.
output.Character Action: The kids run through the tall grass, excitement on their faces.
output.Narration: The kids couldn't believe their eyes.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate riverbank, Character Action: Emma kneels down to touch the river, Dialogue: 'It really is chocolate!', Narration: 'Emma confirmed the impossible.'

output.Setting: The riverbank with rich, flowing chocolate.
output.Character Action: Emma kneels down, touching the surface of the chocolate river.
output.Narration: Emma confirmed the impossible.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate riverbank, Character Action: Leo takes a cautious taste, Dialogue: 'Whoa, it tastes amazing!', Narration: 'Leo couldn't resist trying it.'

output.Setting: The riverbank, with Leo leaning over to take a small sip.
output.Character Action: Leo tastes the chocolate, his eyes widening in surprise.
output.Narration: Leo couldn't resist trying it.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate river, Character Action: Max points to a boat made of candy floating by, Dialogue: 'Look! A boat made of candy!', Narration: 'The river seemed full of surprises.'

output.Setting: The chocolate river with a colorful candy boat floating by.
output.Character Action: Max points excitedly at the boat.
output.Narration: The river seemed full of surprises.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Candy boat, Character Action: The kids climb into the boat, Dialogue: 'Let's go on an adventure!', Narration: 'They couldn't resist the call of adventure.'

output.Setting: The candy boat with chocolate flowing around it.
output.Character Action: The kids carefully climb into the boat, full of excitement.
output.Narration: They couldn't resist the call of adventure.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: On the river, Character Action: The boat floats along the chocolate river, Dialogue: 'This is like a dream!', Narration: 'The boat gently drifted down the chocolate stream.'

output.Setting: The kids sitting in the boat, surrounded by flowing chocolate.
output.Character Action: The kids look around in awe, enjoying the ride.
output.Narration: The boat gently drifted down the chocolate stream.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: River bend, Character Action: The boat approaches a bend, revealing a waterfall of caramel, Dialogue: 'Look at that! A caramel waterfall!', Narration: 'The river held even more wonders.'

output.Setting: The riverbend with a waterfall of caramel flowing into the chocolate river.
output.Character Action: The kids point in amazement at the caramel waterfall.
output.Narration: The river held even more wonders.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Caramel waterfall, Character Action: Leo reaches out to catch some caramel, Dialogue: 'It's so sticky!', Narration: 'Leo couldn’t resist tasting the caramel.'

output.Setting: The edge of the candy boat, with Leo reaching out.
output.Character Action: Leo catches a bit of caramel on his fingers, looking amused.
output.Narration: Leo couldn’t resist tasting the caramel.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate river, Character Action: Emma spots something shiny in the water, Dialogue: 'Hey, what's that down there?', Narration: 'A mysterious glimmer caught Emma’s eye.'

output.Setting: The river with a faint glimmer visible beneath the surface.
output.Character Action: Emma leans over the side of the boat, staring at the water.
output.Narration: A mysterious glimmer caught Emma’s eye.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate river, Character Action: Max uses a net to scoop up a shiny object, Dialogue: 'I got it!', Narration: 'Max was quick to act.'

output.Setting: The boat with Max holding a small net over the side.
output.Character Action: Max carefully pulls a shiny object from the water.
output.Narration: Max was quick to act.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: In the boat, Character Action: The kids examine a golden key, Dialogue: 'It's a golden key! What could it unlock?', Narration: 'The mystery deepened with their discovery.'

output.Setting: The kids huddled together in the boat.
output.Character Action: Max holds a shiny golden key while the others look on curiously.
output.Dialogue: 'It's a golden key! What could it unlock?'
output.Narration: The mystery deepened with their discovery.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Further down the river, Character Action: The kids notice a large chocolate castle, Dialogue: 'Look! A castle made of chocolate!', Narration: 'The river was leading them to something even more magical.'

output.Setting: A grand castle made entirely of chocolate, rising in the distance.
output.Character Action: The kids stare in awe, pointing towards the castle.
output.Narration: The river was leading them to something even more magical.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate castle entrance, Character Action: The boat stops near the entrance, Dialogue: 'Do you think this key opens the castle?', Narration: 'They were eager to explore.'

output.Setting: The boat docked near the grand entrance of the chocolate castle.
output.Character Action: Emma holds up the golden key, looking at the castle door.
output.Dialogue: 'Do you think this key opens the castle?'
output.Narration: They were eager to explore.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate castle door, Character Action: Max inserts the key into the door, Dialogue: 'Only one way to find out!', Narration: 'The moment of truth had arrived.'

output.Setting: The large chocolate door with an ornate lock.
output.Character Action: Max inserts the golden key into the lock, turning it slowly.
output.Narration: The moment of truth had arrived.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Inside the castle, Character Action: The door opens, revealing a grand hall made of chocolate, Dialogue: 'Wow... it’s like a dream come true!', Narration: 'The inside of the castle was even more magical.'

output.Setting: A grand hall made entirely of chocolate, with chocolate statues and a chocolate fountain.
output.Character Action: The kids step inside, eyes wide with amazement.
output.Dialogue: 'Wow... it’s like a dream come true!'
output.Narration: The inside of the castle was even more magical.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate fountain, Character Action: Leo dips his finger into the chocolate fountain, Dialogue: 'This is the best chocolate ever!', Narration: 'The kids couldn’t resist tasting the fountain.'

output.Setting: A chocolate fountain in the center of the hall.
output.Character Action: Leo dips his finger into the flowing chocolate, smiling.
output.Narration: The kids couldn’t resist tasting the fountain.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Throne room, Character Action: The kids enter a room with a chocolate throne, Dialogue: 'Do you think someone lives here?', Narration: 'The castle seemed to have a story of its own.'

output.Setting: A large throne room with a chocolate throne at the far end.
output.Character Action: The kids cautiously step into the room, looking around.
output.Narration: The castle seemed to have a story of its own.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Throne room, Character Action: Emma finds a map on a table, Dialogue: 'Look, it’s a map of the castle!', Narration: 'The map promised even more hidden wonders.'

output.Setting: A chocolate table with a rolled-up map.
output.Character Action: Emma unrolls the map, her eyes lighting up.
output.Dialogue: 'Look, it’s a map of the castle!'
output.Narration: The map promised even more hidden wonders.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Hidden passageway, Character Action: The kids follow the map to a hidden passage, Dialogue: 'I wonder where this leads...', Narration: 'The adventure continued deeper into the castle.'

output.Setting: A narrow passageway made of chocolate bricks.
output.Character Action: The kids walk cautiously into the passageway, following the map.
output.Narration: The adventure continued deeper into the castle.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Hidden room, Character Action: The kids discover a room filled with golden chocolate coins, Dialogue: 'Jackpot!', Narration: 'The hidden room was a treasure trove.'

output.Setting: A hidden room filled with piles of golden chocolate coins.
output.Character Action: The kids look around in amazement, their faces lighting up.
output.Narration: The hidden room was a treasure trove.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Hidden room, Character Action: Max picks up a coin, Dialogue: 'I think we should take some back!', Narration: 'They couldn’t leave without a souvenir.'

output.Setting: Max holding a shiny golden chocolate coin.
output.Character Action: Max examines the coin with a grin.
output.Dialogue: 'I think we should take some back!'
output.Narration: They couldn’t leave without a souvenir.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Throne room, Character Action: The kids return to the throne room, Dialogue: 'We should head back before it gets dark.', Narration: 'The adventure had to come to an end.'

output.Setting: The throne room with the chocolate throne in the background.
output.Character Action: The kids stand together, looking at the map one last time.
output.Dialogue: 'We should head back before it gets dark.'
output.Narration: The adventure had to come to an end.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Chocolate river, Character Action: The kids board the candy boat, Dialogue: 'Goodbye, chocolate castle!', Narration: 'They left with memories they would never forget.'

output.Setting: The kids getting back into the candy boat, with the castle in the background.
output.Character Action: The kids wave at the castle as they board the boat.
output.Narration: They left with memories they would never forget.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Forest edge, Character Action: The boat arrives back at the forest edge, Dialogue: 'I can’t believe we just did that!', Narration: 'The adventure felt like a wonderful dream.'

output.Setting: The boat docking at the forest edge where the adventure began.
output.Character Action: The kids step out of the boat, smiling at each other.
output.Dialogue: 'I can’t believe we just did that!'
output.Narration: The adventure felt like a wonderful dream.

story.input: Create a comic book panel with: Setting: Forest path, Character Action: The kids walk home with some chocolate coins, Dialogue: 'No one will ever believe us!', Narration: 'They carried their treasure and memories with them.'

output.Setting: A forest path with the kids walking towards home.
output.Character Action: The kids walk together, holding some chocolate coins.
output.Narration: They carried their treasure and memories with them.
